title: How to look younger: Martha Stewart's shares exactly when to start anti-aging skincare - Daily Express US
text: How to look younger: Martha Stewart's shares exactly when to start anti-aging skincare Martha Stewart attributes her ageless skin to a very simple list of lifestyle choices that have kept her looking fabulously young for decades. Martha Stewart on remote working “I just don’t agree with it” [Martha Stewart](/latest/martha-stewart) looks [more youthful](/lifestyle/food-drink/133257/Golden-Bachelor-edith-guacamole-recipe-skincare) than ever at 82 - with the octogenarian often posting [sultry thirst-traps wowing followers](/entertainment/celebrity-news/122821/Martha-Stewart-shares-thirst-trap-snaps-on-Instagram-in-grey-lace-lingerie). The grandmother has many fans wondering [how she has achieved her ageless complexion](/lifestyle/beauty/134727/how-to-look-younger-anti-aging-beauty-skincare). Luckily, the lifestyle guru opened up about her [skin](/latest/skincare) and [how she has been looking after it](/entertainment/celebrity-news/127358/Martha-Stewart-young-botox-fillers) for decades now. She told [People](https://people.com/martha-stewart-advice-successful-career-health-aging-qvc-interview-exclusive-8631361): "My feeling about good looks and about good health is that you have to start early — so 50 is a very good time to start!" "I try to live a very healthy life. I eat extremely well. I take care of myself. I go to the gym no matter what, four times a week.” Delving deeper into her skincare secrets, the TV legend confessed: “I take care of my skin very, very well, and everybody can do that. Read more: ['I'm a makeup expert - my skin is plumper and more cushiony thanks my technique'](/lifestyle/beauty/134835/anti-aging-skincare-how-to-look-younger) “It's not like I spend a fortune on any of that stuff, but I managed to do it because it's going to make a difference and I'm going to live longer and healthier." Stewart went on to clarify that she doesn't "believe in anti-aging" but is convinced that there are things that will give you more longevity in a healthy way. "I really sort of practice what I preach," Stewart highlighted about her usual advice for a healthy and happy life. Back in February, Stewart openly discussed her cosmetic procedures in an episode of The Martha Stewart Podcast on iHeartPodcasts. She candidly attributed her flawless skin to botox, fillers, and skin-tightening treatments during her conversation with cosmetic dermatologist Dr. Dan Belkin. Don't miss... [ 'My grandmother looks 20 years younger thanks to $4.49 product from her teens' ](/lifestyle/beauty/134727/how-to-look-younger-anti-aging-beauty-skincare) [SKINCARE] [ Kendall Jenner's fitness routine is simple and takes only 10 minutes ](/lifestyle/diet-fitness/134716/kendall-jenner-diet-fitness-exercise) [FITNESS] [ These states were ranked worst in the US for skin, nail and hair health ](/lifestyle/beauty/134251/worst-US-states-skin-nail-hair-health) [INSIGHT] The discussion, which served as the season two premiere of her podcast, airing new episodes every Wednesday, sheds light on the curiosity surrounding Stewart's youthful appearance. "Everybody is so interested when they see a selfie of me posted on the internet," Stewart shares. Dr. Belkin himself detailed the treatments he has performed on Stewart, including muscle-relaxing injections along her neck and jawline and fillers in her cheeks. During the candid conversation, Stewart even humorously noted the mixed results of botox on her upper face, leading to an unnatural V shape of her eyebrows.
